pr_title: related to #6150: change GUI to something Locus-alike

timeline.bodyText: Your hard-coded translations will be overwritten by crowdin automatically. So if you want to provide these translations, you will have to translate them via the crowdin UI after the PR was merged. Or, if you want to make it easy for yourself, you can simply ignore all the translations as outdated ones will be removed automatically...
timeline.author: fm-sys
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -777,7 +777,7 @@
     <string name="map_source_osm_cyclosm">CyclOSM</string>
     <string name="map_source_osm_offline">Offline</string>
     <string name="map_source_osm_offline_combined">Kombinované (Offline)</string>
-    <string name="map_source_osm_offline_combined_attribution_details">Kombinovaná (%d map, %d atributů): klikněte pro podrobnosti</string>
+    <string name="map_source_osm_offline_combined_attribution_details">Kombinovaná (%d atributů): klikněte pro podrobnosti</string>

replies.bodyText:
Hi @fm-sys, thanks for the hint. I am aware of that, but I needed to make the modification because lint was complaining due to the mismatch of parameters in the strings vs parameters given in the code (because I reduced the number of paramus from 2 to 1).
So it is fine if those changes are overridden by Crowdin, but I need to make them in order to go through the Android Studio checks (and presumably also through the CI/Crowdin checks although I did not try this out)
replies.author: eddiemuc

replies.bodyText: Then it would be the best to delete such lines.
replies.author: bekuno

replies.bodyText:
Then it would be the best to delete such lines.

I still need the translation, it just does not contain 2 parameters an more (just one)
replies.author: eddiemuc

replies.bodyText:
We only discuss on the translated strings, not for the english strings.
The translations are only interesting for your coding if it is necessary to use them in your tests.
Only the english strings are interesting otherwise. They are the fallback language if the string not exist in the used language.
The translation work what you have done is useless then. It will be replaced by the crowdin PR. The englich strings are the base for the work at crowdin, nothing else.
replies.author: bekuno

replies.bodyText: Strings are irrelevant with newest changes, so I guess discussion can be resolved
replies.author: eddiemuc

timeline.bodyText:
This is a PluralsCandidate for the lint check, see e.g.
https://ci.cgeo.org/job/cgeo%20pull%20request/3919/androidLintResult/package.-963969145/source.-6884541216426645145/#819
Please have a look at the discussion in #8456
timeline.author: bekuno
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -812,11 +812,9 @@
     <string name="map_source_osm_osmde">OpenStreetMap.de</string>
     <string name="map_source_osm_cyclosm">CyclOSM</string>
     <string name="map_source_osm_offline">Offline</string>
-    <string name="map_source_osm_offline_attribution_pleasewait">(Please wait…)</string>
+    <string name="map_source_osm_offline_attribution_pleasewait">Please wait…</string>
     <string name="map_source_osm_offline_combined">Combined (Offline)</string>
-    <string name="map_source_osm_offline_combined_attribution_pleasewait">Combined (%d maps, please wait…)</string>
-    <string name="map_source_osm_offline_combined_attribution_details">Combined (%d maps, %d attributions): click for details</string>
-    <string name="map_source_osm_offline_combined_attribution_single">Combined (%d maps): %s</string>
+    <string name="map_source_osm_offline_combined_attribution_details">%d attributions, click for details</string>

replies.bodyText:
This is a PluralsCandidate for the lint check, see e.g.
https://ci.cgeo.org/job/cgeo%20pull%20request/3919/androidLintResult/package.-963969145/source.-6884541216426645145/#819
Please have a look at the discussion in #8456

This translation is used in code only if given parameter is 2 or more (never for singular case), see other parts of this PR. Thus the singular/plural problem does not apply here imho.
replies.author: eddiemuc

replies.bodyText:
Please see at #8456 (comment).
And the rules for those numbers seem to vary a lot from language to language, according to the docs we need to support zero, one, two, few, many and other, although most languages only use one or two of those identifiers.
So we have to support two, few, many and other here.
replies.author: bekuno

replies.bodyText: Strings are irrelevant with newest changes, so I guess discussion can be resolved
replies.author: eddiemuc
